title: CAHP (Cardiac Arrest Hospital Prognosis) Score
desc: The CAHP (Cardiac Arrest Hospital Prognosis) Score predicts poor prognosis after out-of-hospital cardiac arrest.

orgreference.text: Maupain C, Bougouin W, Lamhaut L, et al. The CAHP (Cardiac Arrest Hospital Prognosis) score: a tool for risk stratification after out-of-hospital cardiac arrest. Eur Heart J. 2016;37(42):3222-3228.

other_refer.text: Debaty G, Babaz V, Durand M, et al. Prognostic factors for extracorporeal cardiopulmonary resuscitation recipients following out-of-hospital refractory cardiac arrest. A systematic review and meta-analysis. Resuscitation. 2017;112:1-10.
Isenschmid C, Luescher T, Rasiah R, et al. Performance of clinical risk scores to predict mortality and neurological outcome in cardiac arrest patients. Resuscitation. 2019;136:21-29.

data.facts:
Interpretation:

CAHP Score Risk of poor outcome Risk of poor neurological outcome*
<150 Low 39%
150-200 Moderate 81%
>200 High 100%

*Defined as Cerebral Performance Category of 3 (severe disability), 4 (vegetative state), and 5 (death) at hospital discharge.

inputs.label_en: Rumination, regurgitation, self-induced vomiting, and eating disorders are not included.
inputs.name: shockable

inputs.label_en: There was no indication during routine investigations (including upper endoscopy) of any organic, systemic, or metabolic diseases that could account for the symptoms.
inputs.name: collapse

inputs.label_en: Duration from CPR to <abbr title="Return of spontaneous circulation">ROSC</abbr>
